result.name: Abnormality of the hand
result.definition: An abnormality affecting one or both hands.

result.name: Abnormal thumb morphology
result.definition: An abnormal structure of the first digit of the hand.

result.name: Abnormal carpal morphology
result.definition: An abnormality affecting the carpal bones of the wrist (scaphoid, lunate, triquetral, pisiform, trapezium, trapezoid, capitate, hamate).

result.name: Abnormalities of placenta or umbilical cord
result.definition: An abnormality of the placenta (the organ that connects the developing fetus to the uterine wall) or of the umbilical cord (the cord that connects the fetus to the placenta).
synonyms: Abnormalities of placenta or umbilical cord

result.name: Abnormality of prenatal development or birth
result.definition: An abnormality of the fetus or the birth of the fetus, excluding structural abnormalities.
synonyms: Abnormality of prenatal development or birth

result.name: Abnormal fingertip morphology
result.definition: An abnormal structure of the tip (end) of a finger.

result.name: Abnormality of the thenar eminence
result.definition: An abnormality of the thenar eminence, i.e., of the muscle on the palm of the human hand just beneath the thumb.

result.name: Abnormal fingernail morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the fingernails.

result.name: Abnormal corpus callosum morphology
result.definition: Abnormality of the corpus callosum.

result.name: Abnormal cranial nerve morphology
result.definition: Structural abnormality affecting one or more of the cranial nerves, which emerge directly from the brain stem.

result.name: Abnormal nervous system electrophysiology
result.definition: An abnormality of the function of the electrical signals with which nerve cells communicate with each other or with muscles as measured by electrophysiological investigations.

result.name: Abnormal cerebellum morphology
result.definition: Any structural abnormality of the cerebellum.

result.name: Abnormal joint morphology
result.definition: An abnormal structure or form of the joints, i.e., one or more of the articulations where two bones join.

result.name: Abnormal hip joint morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the hip joint.

result.name: Abnormal abdomen morphology
result.definition: A structural abnormality of the abdomen ('belly'), that is, the part of the body between the pelvis and the thorax.

result.name: Abnormal pulmonary valve morphology
result.definition: Any structural abnormality of the pulmonary valve.

result.name: Abnormal pericardium morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the pericardium, i.e., of the fluid filled sac that surrounds the heart and the proximal ends of the aorta, vena cava, and the pulmonary artery.

result.name: Abnormal left ventricle morphology
result.definition: Any structural abnormality of the left ventricle of the heart.

result.name: Abnormality of the pancreas
result.definition: An abnormality of the pancreas.

result.name: Abnormal foot morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the skeleton of foot.

result.name: Abnormal delivery
result.definition: An abnormality of the birth process.

result.name: Abnormal hallux morphology
result.definition: This term applies for all abnormalities of the big toe, also called hallux.

result.name: Abnormality of the tarsal bones
result.definition: An abnormality of the tarsus are the cluster of seven bones in the foot between the tibia and fibula and the metatarsus, including the calcaneus (heel) bone and the talus (ankle) bone.

result.name: Abnormality of thrombocytes
result.definition: An abnormality of platelets.

result.name: Abnormal erythrocyte morphology
result.definition: Any structural abnormality of erythrocytes (red-blood cells).

result.name: Abnormal eosinophil morphology
result.definition: An abnormal count or structure of eosinophils.

result.name: Abnormal granulocyte morphology
result.definition: Any structural abnormality or abnormal count of granulocytes.

result.name: Abnormal leukocyte morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of leukocytes.

result.name: Abnormal facial shape
result.definition: An abnormal morphology (form) of the face or its components.

result.name: Abnormality of the glabella
result.definition: An abnormality of the glabella.
synonyms: Abnormality of the area between the eyebrows
Deformity of the area between the eyebrows
Malformation of the area between the eyebrows

result.name: Morphological abnormality of the pyramidal tract
result.definition: Any structural abnormality of the pyramidal tract, whose chief element, the corticospinal tract, is the only direct connection between the brain and the spinal cord. In addition to the corticospinal tract, the pyramidal system includes the corticobulbar, corticomesencephalic, and corticopontine tracts.

result.name: Abnormal spinal cord morphology
result.definition: A structural abnormality of the spinal cord (myelon).

result.name: Abnormal intestine morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the intestine. The closely related term enteropathy is used to refer to any disease of the intestine.

result.name: Abnormal small intestine morphology
result.definition: A structural abnormality of the small intestine.

result.name: Abnormal large intestine morphology
result.definition: Any abnormality of the large intestine.

result.name: EEG abnormality
result.definition: Abnormality observed by electroencephalogram (EEG), which is used to record of the brain's spontaneous electrical activity from multiple electrodes placed on the scalp.

result.name: Abnormal midbrain morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the midbrain, which has as its parts the tectum, cerebral peduncle, midbrain tegmentum and cerebral aqueduct.

result.name: Abnormal rapid eye movement sleep
result.definition: Abnormality of REM sleep. Phases of REM sleep are characterized by desynchronized EEG patterns, increases in heart rate and blood pressure, sympathetic activation, and a profound loss of muscle tonus except for the eye and middle-ear muscles. There are then phases of rapid eye movements.

result.name: Morphological abnormality of the corticospinal tract
result.definition: Abnormality of the corticospinal tract, which is the chief element of the pyramidal system (the principle motor tract) and is the only direct connection between the cerebrum and the spinal cord.

result.name: Abnormal cerebral white matter morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the cerebral white matter.
synonyms: Abnormality of the cerebral white matter
Cortical white matter abnormalities seen on MRI

result.name: Abnormal stomach morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the stomach.

result.name: Abnormal pelvic girdle bone morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the bony pelvic girdle, which is a ring of bones connecting the vertebral column to the femurs.
synonyms: Abnormal shape of pelvic girdle bone
Abnormality of pelvic girdle bone morphology

result.name: Abnormal calvaria morphology
result.definition: Abnormality of the morphology (structure) of the calvaria (skullcap), that is, of that part of the skull that is made up of the superior portions of the frontal bone, occipital bone, and parietal bones and covers the cranial cavity that contains the brain.
synonyms: Abnormality of the shape of calvarium

result.name: Abnormal parietal bone morphology
result.definition: Any abnormality of the parietal bone of the skull.
synonyms: Abnormality of the parietal bone of skull

result.name: Abnormal foramen magnum morphology
result.definition: Any abnormality of the foramen magnum.

result.name: Abnormality of skull ossification
result.definition: An abnormality of the process of ossification of the skull.
synonyms: Abnormality of bone calcification of calvarium
Abnormality of bone calcification of cranium
Abnormality of bone calcification of skull
Abnormality of bone formation of calvarium
Abnormality of bone formation of cranium
Abnormality of bone mineralization of calvarium
Abnormality of bone mineralization of cranium
Abnormality of bone mineralization of skull

result.name: Abnormality of the immune system
result.definition: An abnormality of the immune system.

result.name: Abnormal skull base morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the base of the skull, which forms the floor of the cranial cavity and separates the brain from other facial structures. The skull base is made up of five bones: the ethmoid, sphenoid, occipital, paired frontal, and paired parietal bones, and is subdivided into 3 regions: the anterior, middle, and posterior cranial fossae. The petro-occipital fissure subdivides the middle cranial fossa into 1 central component and 2 lateral components.

result.name: Abnormal lymph node morphology
result.definition: A structural lymph node abnormality.

result.name: Abnormal cartilage morphology
result.definition: Any morphological abnormality of cartilage.

result.name: Abnormality of the lower limb
result.definition: An abnormality of the leg.

result.name: Abnormality of the knee
result.definition: An abnormality of the knee joint or surrounding structures.

result.name: Abnormality of the upper limb
result.definition: An abnormality of the arm.

result.name: Abnormality of limb bone morphology
result.definition: Any abnormality of bones of the arms or legs.

result.name: Abnormal morphology of the radius
result.definition: An abnormality of the radius.

result.name: Abnormal T cell morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of T cells.

result.name: Abnormal ilium morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the ilium, the largest and uppermost bone of the pelvis.

result.name: Abnormal cerebrospinal fluid morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

result.name: Abnormal forearm morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the lower arm.

result.name: Abnormality of the wrist
result.definition: Abnormality of the wrist, the structure connecting the hand and the forearm.

result.name: Abnormal cortical bone morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of compact bone (also known as cortical bone), which forms the dense surface of bones.

result.name: Abnormal blood ion concentration
result.definition: Abnormality of the homeostasis (concentration) of a monoatomic ion.

result.name: Abnormal EKG
result.definition: Abnormal rhythm of the heart.

result.name: Abnormal circulating hormone concentration
result.definition: An abnormal concentration of a hormone in the blood.

result.name: Abnormal acetabulum morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the acetabulum, i.e., the Acetabular part of hip bone, which together with the head of the femur forms the hip joint.

result.name: Abnormal hip bone morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the hip bone.

result.name: Abnormal form of the vertebral bodies
result.definition: Abnormal morphology of vertebral body.

result.name: Abnormality of the cervical spine
result.definition: Any abnormality of the cervical vertebral column.

result.name: Abnormality of the odontoid process
result.definition: Abnormality of the dens of the axis, which is also known as the odontoid process.

result.name: Abnormal femoral head morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the femoral head.

result.name: Abnormal femoral neck morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).

result.name: Abnormal synaptic transmission at the neuromuscular junction
result.definition: Any abnormality of the neuromuscular junction, which is the synapse between the motor end plate of a motor neuron and the skeletal muscle fibers.

result.name: Abnormal 5th finger phalanx morphology
result.definition: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 5th (little) finger.
synonyms: Abnormality of the little finger bone
Abnormality of the phalanges of the 5th finger
Abnormality of the pinkie finger bone
Abnormality of the pinky finger bone

result.name: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
result.definition: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 5th (little) finger.
synonyms: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the little finger
Abnormality of the outermost little finger bone
Abnormality of the outermost pinkie finger bone
Abnormality of the outermost pinky finger bone
Abnormality of the terminal phalanx of the little finger

result.name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
result.definition: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the fifth finger. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.
synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of middle little finger bone
Abnormality of the end part of middle pinkie finger bone
Abnormality of the end part of middle pinky finger bone

result.name: Abnormality of the abdominal wall
result.definition: The presence of any abnormality affecting the abdominal wall.
synonyms: Abnormality of external features of the abdomen

result.name: Abnormal endocardium morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the endocardium.

result.name: Abnormal reticulocyte morphology
result.definition: A reticulocyte abnormality.

result.name: Abnormal muscle fiber morphology
result.definition: Any abnormality of the skeletal muscle cell. Muscle fibers are subdivided into two types. Type I fibers are fatigue-resistant and rich in oxidative enzymes (they stain light with the myosin ATPase reaction), and type II fibers are fast-contracting, fatigue-prone, and rich in glycolytic enzymes (these fibers stain darkly). Normal muscle tissue has a random distribution of type I and type II fibers.

result.name: Abnormal anterior eye segment morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the anterior segment of the eyeball (which comprises the structures in front of the vitreous humour: the cornea, iris, ciliary body, and lens).
synonyms: Abnormality of the anterior segment of the eye
Abnormality of the anterior segment of the eyeball
Abnormality of the anterior segment of the globe

result.name: Abnormality of amino acid metabolism
result.definition: Abnormality of an amino acid metabolic process.

result.name: Abnormal glycosphingolipid metabolism
result.definition: An abnormality of glycosphingolipid metabolism.

result.name: Abnormal circulating leptin concentration
result.definition: An abnormal concentration of leptin in the blood.

result.name: Abnormality of the anus
result.definition: Abnormality of the anal canal.

result.name: Abnormality of the pulmonary artery
result.definition: An abnormality of the pulmonary artery.

result.name: Abnormal renal collecting system morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the renal collecting system.
synonyms: Abnormality of the renal collecting system

result.name: Abnormal oral glucose tolerance
result.definition: An abnormal resistance to glucose, i.e., a reduction in the ability to maintain glucose levels in the blood stream within normal limits following oral administration of glucose.

result.name: Abnormal magnesium concentration
result.definition: An abnormality of magnesium ion homeostasis.

result.name: Abnormal sacrum morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the sacral bone.

result.name: Abnormal cardiac atrium morphology
result.definition: Any structural abnormality of a cardiac atrium.

result.name: Abnormal T-wave
result.definition: An abnormality of the T wave on the electrocardiogram, which mainly represents the repolarization of the ventricles.

result.name: Abnormal intervertebral disk morphology
result.definition: Any structural abnormality of the intervertebral disk.

result.name: Abnormality of the Achilles tendon
result.definition: An abnormality of the Achilles tendon.

result.name: Abnormal nostril morphology
result.definition: Abnormality of the nostril.

result.name: Abnormal vena cava morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the structure of the veins that return deoxygenated blood from the body into the heart, i.e., the superior vena cava and the inferior vena cava.

result.name: Abnormality of B cell physiology
result.definition: An abnormality of the physiological functioning of B cells.

result.name: Abnormal carotid artery morphology
result.definition: Any structural abnormality of the carotid arteries, including the common carotid artery and its' arterial branches.

result.name: Abnormal zygomatic arch morphology
result.definition: An abnormality of the zygomatic arch, also known as the cheek bone.

result.name: Abnormal metacarpal morphology
result.definition: Any abnormal shape or structure of the metacarpal bones.
synonyms: Abnormal shape of long bones of hand

result.name: Abnormal cervical curvature
result.definition: The presence of an abnormal curvature of the cervical vertebral column.
